intro: Isocarpha microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed isocarpha, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, hairy seeds. Isocarpha microcephala is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
